title: Starter Package
description: Build digital confidence from scratch. In just 2 weeks you will go from zero to creating professional documents, using email like a pro, and navigating the internet safely — skills every campus student needs.
shortDescription: Master computing basics in 2 focused weeks.
outcomes: Use a computer and Windows OS confidently
Organize files and folders professionally
Create and send professional emails
Build a clean, well-formatted CV
Write formal letters and academic documents
Stay safe online and understand digital footprints

syllabus.title: Computer & Internet Fundamentals
topics: Computer components — Hardware vs Software
Windows Operating System basics and navigation
File and folder management (creating, renaming, organizing)
Internet browsing and effective searching (Google, Chrome, Edge)
Creating and using a professional email account
Digital safety — passwords, scams, phishing, privacy
activities: Create an organized academic folder structure
Set up a professional Gmail account
Practice safe downloads and identify suspicious links
Use Google Drive for cloud file backup
syllabus.assignment: Create and organize a full academic folder system. Submit a screenshot of your professional email setup and write one professional email to a lecturer asking for an extension.

syllabus.title: Microsoft Word — Document Creation
topics: Word interface and toolbar navigation
Text and paragraph formatting (fonts, spacing, alignment)
Inserting tables, images, and headers/footers
Page layout and document design
Creating a professional CV and formal letter
Saving and exporting documents as PDF
activities: Format a raw document using Word tools
Build a 1-page professional CV from scratch
Write and format a formal job application letter
Export the CV as a PDF ready to send to employers
syllabus.assignment: Submit a complete, formatted CV and a formal Application Letter using Microsoft Word.

syllabus.title: Digital Communication & Online Etiquette
topics: Writing professional emails — structure, tone, subject lines
WhatsApp and Telegram professionalism in academic and work settings
Zoom and Google Meet etiquette (camera, mute, punctuality)
Understanding your digital footprint and online reputation
activities: Rewrite 3 unprofessional messages into professional ones
Practice a mock Zoom meeting introduction
Audit your social media profile for professionalism
project: Short Academic Assignment — 1 to 2 pages, properly formatted

title: Intermediate Package
description: Everything in the Starter Package — plus 2 more power-packed weeks covering Excel data skills, database basics, and professional graphic design with Canva. By the end you will have real, monetizable skills.
shortDescription: Starter skills + Excel, databases and Canva design.
outcomes: Analyze and visualize data using Microsoft Excel
Create and query a simple database in Microsoft Access
Design professional posters, graphics, and brand kits in Canva
Build a beginner design portfolio for campus clients
Understand how to price and sell graphic design services
All Starter Package outcomes included

syllabus.title: Starter Package Content (Included)
topics: Computer and Internet Fundamentals (Module 1)
Microsoft Word and Document Creation (Module 2)
Digital Communication and Online Etiquette (Module 3)
activities: All Week 1 and Week 2 practical activities from the Starter Package
syllabus.assignment: All Starter Package assignments — CV, Application Letter, and professional email write-up.

syllabus.title: Microsoft Excel — Data Entry & Analysis
topics: Spreadsheet basics — rows, columns, cells, navigation
Data entry and formatting (numbers, dates, text, borders)
Essential formulas — SUM, AVERAGE, COUNT, IF
Charts and data visualization (bar, pie, line charts)
Personal budgeting and student record keeping
activities: Build a personal monthly budget spreadsheet
Create a student grade tracker using formulas
Generate and format a chart from live data
Compare two datasets using conditional formatting
syllabus.assignment: Submit a working expense tracker spreadsheet with at least 3 formulas (SUM, AVERAGE, COUNT) and one chart visualizing the data.

syllabus.title: Microsoft Access — Database Basics
topics: What databases are and why they matter
Tables, fields, and records — understanding structure
Creating a simple database from scratch
Forms for easy data entry
Basic queries to filter and find information
Real-life examples — inventory system, student records
activities: Build a simple student records database
Create a data entry form for adding new students
Run a query to filter students by grade or course
syllabus.assignment: Create a simple inventory or student database with at least 10 records, one form, and one working query.

syllabus.title: Graphic Design Using Canva
topics: Canva interface — tools, templates, elements
Design principles — color theory, fonts, layout, whitespace
Creating posters and social media graphics
Personal and business branding basics
Exporting client-ready designs (PNG, PDF, MP4)
How to price your designs and find campus clients
Building a beginner design portfolio
activities: Design a campus event poster from scratch
Create a 3-post social media graphic set (Instagram/WhatsApp)
Build a simple brand kit — logo, colors, tagline
Compile designs into a shareable portfolio folder
project: Simple brand kit for a mock client
Beginner design portfolio (PDF or shared link)

title: Pro Package
description: The complete Digital Skills Bootcamp. All Starter and Intermediate content PLUS AI tools, prompt engineering, career readiness, copywriting, social media marketing, and a final capstone project — everything you need to earn money with your skills.
shortDescription: Full bootcamp — digital skills, AI, career and monetization.
outcomes: Be fully digitally literate across all tools
Use Microsoft Office professionally
Create and sell graphic designs using Canva
Use AI tools responsibly and efficiently
Write persuasive copy and social media content
Build a personal brand and grow an online audience
Start freelancing or offer digital services
Be campus-ready and career-aware
All Starter and Intermediate outcomes included

syllabus.title: Starter & Intermediate Content (Included)
topics: Computer, internet and email fundamentals (Module 1)
Microsoft Word and document creation (Module 2)
Digital communication and online etiquette (Module 3)
Microsoft Excel — data and analysis (Module 4)
Microsoft Access — databases (Module 5)
Graphic design using Canva (Module 6)
activities: All Starter and Intermediate practical activities
CV, Application Letter, budget tracker, database, design portfolio
syllabus.assignment: All Starter and Intermediate assignments included.

syllabus.title: AI Skills for Students
topics: What Artificial Intelligence actually is (plain English)
Using AI for studying, research, and summarizing notes
AI writing and paraphrasing tools (ChatGPT, Gemini, Copilot)
Content and idea generation with AI
Ethical AI use — avoiding plagiarism, academic integrity
Free AI tools every student should know
activities: Use AI to summarize a 5-page document into bullet points
Compare AI-generated vs manually written paragraphs
Use AI to generate 3 ideas for a business or campus event
Create a personal reference sheet of your top free AI tools
syllabus.assignment: Use an AI tool to improve one of your previous assignments. Submit both the original and the AI-assisted version, plus a short reflection paragraph on the differences.

syllabus.title: Prompt Engineering for Beginners
topics: What prompts are and how AI reads them
Prompt structure — Role + Task + Format + Context
Writing effective prompts step by step
Prompts for assignments and academic writing
Prompts for Canva design ideas and concepts
Prompts for marketing copy and social media captions
Prompts for content planning and business ideas
activities: Write 5 structured prompts using the Role-Task-Format method
Use a prompt to generate a complete content calendar
Improve a Canva design brief using AI prompts
Compare outputs from a weak prompt vs a strong prompt
syllabus.assignment: Submit 5 polished, structured prompts covering at least 3 different use cases (study, design, marketing). Include the AI output for each.

syllabus.title: Career Readiness & Campus Life
topics: Digital expectations in campus and the workplace
Time management tools — Google Calendar, Notion, Trello
Online learning platforms — Coursera, YouTube, LinkedIn Learning
Improving your CV for internships and part-time jobs
Interview basics — preparation, body language, follow-up
Building a professional online identity (LinkedIn, email signature)
activities: Set up a Google Calendar with your weekly study schedule
Update your CV with all skills learned in this bootcamp
Create or clean up your LinkedIn profile
Practice a 2-minute mock interview self-introduction
syllabus.assignment: Submit an updated CV reflecting your digital skills, plus a screenshot of your completed LinkedIn or professional online profile.

syllabus.title: Copywriting, Social Media & Content Creation
topics: Copywriting — persuasive captions, product descriptions, and ads
Simple sales copy structure — Problem, Agitate, Solve (PAS)
Social media content planning — weekly content calendar
Posting strategy — best times, formats, hashtags
Engagement tactics — growing followers and building community
Personal branding — your niche, voice, and story
Freelancing basics — Upwork, Fiverr, pricing, and proposals
Brand partnerships and offering digital services locally
activities: Write 5 social media captions for a mock Kenyan brand
Build a 7-day content calendar for Instagram or TikTok
Write a short sales page for one of your own skills
Research 2 freelancing opportunities relevant to your skills
syllabus.assignment: Submit a 7-day content calendar for a brand of your choice, 3 sample captions, and one piece of sales copy using the PAS framework.

syllabus.title: Final Capstone Project
topics: Choosing your monetizable project track
Planning and structuring your presentation
Building and polishing your final deliverable
Presenting your work in PowerPoint (5–7 slides)
Peer and instructor feedback session
Next steps — how to keep growing after the bootcamp
activities: Complete one full monetizable project from your chosen track
Prepare a 5–7 slide PowerPoint presentation
Present your project with a short explanation of your process and results
project: Track A — Canva Design Portfolio (5+ real designs with brief descriptions)
Track B — Social Media Content Plan (full 30-day calendar and captions)
Track C — Copywriting Sample Collection (5+ pieces with context)
Track D — AI Productivity Showcase (5+ prompt use cases with outputs)
Track E — Small Business Digital Setup Plan (complete digital presence plan)
